greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the unique solution of the equation sum_(p prime)(1/p^x) = 1, a constant related to the asymptotic evaluation of the number of prime multiplicative compositions.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 5.5 Kalmar's composition constant, p. 293.
link: Jean-Francois Alcover, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
Hugh L. Montgomery and Gérald Tenenbaum, On multiplicative compositions of integers, Mathematika 63:3 (2017), pp. 1081-1090.
mathematica: digits = 100; eta = x /. FindRoot[PrimeZetaP[x] == 1, {x, 3/2}, WorkingPrecision -> digits+5]; RealDigits[eta, 10, digits] // First
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 06 2014
